Location, temperature, strain

  • Locate sound, motion, heat:
    • Historical survey: sonar, radar, optical, DFOS, seismic, missle defense, autonomous vehicles, robotics
    • Applications: military, seafaring, aviation, defense, astronomy, robotics,

Demonstrating DAS location sensing accuracy. 1. https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-022-31681-x : 2. https://www.nature.com/articles/s41597-025-05119-0?fromPaywallRec=false 3. https://www.nature.com/articles/s41598-023-31490-2?fromPaywallRec=false 4. https://www.nature.com/articles/s44172-024-00274-5?fromPaywallRec=false Basic concepts: - The hyperbolic triangulation method corresponds to one of the standard techniques to estimate the position of a source from the TDOAs between different sensors36. - Considering the large number of sophisticated array processing techniques existing in the literature[^22],23,24,44,45, we are confident that novel approaches will soon emerge to improve the directivity and performance of near- and far-field beamforming techniques for DAS - Note that the approach here demonstrated as a proof of concept is based on one of the simplest array signal processing techniques22,23,24,41
